str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Lydda, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.
Joppa, a coast town of Judea, west-north-west of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Joppe, a place in Palestine.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To delay, hesitate, be slow. From oknos; to be slow.
